newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said on Monday.

"The interbank rate eased a little bit today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly lower but bond prices were slightly higher. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.13/2.08 percent compared with last Friday's yield of 2.26/2.21 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.30/2.25 percent against 2.38/2.33 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$98.05/98.10 from last Friday's close of S$97.93/97.98, September 2001 at S$97.05/97.10 versus S$96.85/96.90 and June 2003 at S$95.05/95.10 against S$94.83/94.88.
The overnight interbank offered rate rose to 2-5/8 2-1/2 percent from last Friday's 2-11/16 2-9/16 percent.
